abstract.text: Specifies scheduling quantum size used during audio processing.
Specifies completion block called after an operation finishes.
Specifies 8-bit unsigned integer used for raw binary buffers and low-level
C interoperability. Enables storage and memory access for audio and media operations.
Specifies supported channel configurations for audio.
Specifies constraint for floating-point generics in low-level audio, DSP, and math
Specifies rendering callback called to fill the buffer with audio samples.
node that captures audio for export.
Specifies musical time divisions for rhythmic values.
Asserts a condition with a custom failure message, improving clarity of
assertion failures during debugging. Recommended for expressive preconditions and invariants.
Set implementations such as Accelerate or KISS for processing.
node that computes energy using RMS analysis.
Specifies source and playback channel setup for a session.
Asserts a Boolean condition in development builds, halting execution
if the condition evaluates to false. Use for runtime validation without affecting builds.
Executes a throwing block and asserts if it fails, emitting diagnostics
while discarding the thrown error. Use for non-critical operations that must be validated.
with diagnostic output for failures. Use when absence is preferable to raising an error.
node that taps into the signal.
that blends dry/wet signals in real-time.
Specifies 32-bit floating-point scalar used for audio-rate signal processing
and computation. Optimized for real-time sample buffers and waveform-based transformations.
node that executes a render callback.
that bridges settings and typed interface.
Specifies attenuation models for spatial audio.
Asserts a condition and returns a fallback value if it fails, enabling
continued execution in controlled failure scenarios. Useful when providing a safe default is preferable.
Specifies media sources for asset loading and decoding.
node that encapsulates an internal subgraph.
Specifies shapes for noise and synthesis generation.
Specifies a unsafe mutable pointer alias for low-level memory access.
that swaps left and right channels.
Specifies filter types for audio equalization.
Specifies algorithms for panning and spatialization
Specifies platform-sized signed integer used for indexing, logic, and frame count
computation. Adapts to 32-bit or 64-bit targets based on architecture and performance constraints.
Executes a throwing block and asserts on failure, returning
an exception is encountered. Provides safe evaluation with internal assertion diagnostics.
Specifies window functions applied in analysis.
providing synchronized access to a parameter.
Specifies 64-bit floating-point scalar used for control-rate or high-precision
signal logic. Enables accurate modulation and interpolation of parameters across cycles.
Specifies constraint for numeric values convertible to high-precision
representation. Enables consistent double-precision computation across scalar and mixed-mode operations.
node that defines audio playback semantics.
Specifies a generic 3D vector with for maths.
node that wraps an operator unit.
